member.name: T:IrcDotNet.IrcStandardFloodPreventer
member.summary: Represents a flood protector that operates according to the de-facto rules implemented by modern IRC servers. The principle is that no message may be sent by the client once the value of an internal counter has reached the value of . The counter is incremented every time a message is sent, and decremented by one every duration of . Hence, messages may be sent immediately in bursts so long as the high rate is not sustained, else a delay is introduced between the sending of successive messages.

member.name: T:IrcDotNet.IIrcFloodPreventer
member.summary: Defines a mechanism for preventing server floods by limiting the rate of outgoing messages from the client.

member.summary: Determines whether the client may currently send a message.
member.returns: if the client may currently send a message; if the client must wait before sending another message.

member.name: M:IrcDotNet.IIrcFloodPreventer.HandleMessageSent
member.summary: Notifies the mechanism that a message has just been send by the client.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The maximum number of messages that can be sent in a burst.
The number of milliseconds between each decrement of the message counter.

member.summary: Gets the maximum message number of messages that can be sent in a burst.
member.value: The maximum message number of messages that can be sent in a burst..

member.name: P:IrcDotNet.IrcStandardFloodPreventer.CounterPeriod
member.summary: Gets the number of milliseconds between each decrement of the message counter.
member.value: The number of milliseconds that is the period of the counter.

Character Query
